changeSet.author: FelixTJDietrich
changeSet.comment:
Migrate TeamRepositoryPermission.hiddenFromContributions data to WorkspaceTeamRepositorySettings.
This is a safety migration to ensure data is not lost when deploying from a branch that has removed the hiddenFromContributions column from the entity. The migration copies all records where hidden_from_contributions=true to the new workspace-scoped settings table.
The workspace_id is determined by matching team.organization to workspace.account_login, which represents the GitHub organization/user that owns both the team and workspace.
changeSet.sql: -- Migrate hidden_from_contributions=true records to workspace_team_repository_settings -- Join path: team_repository_permission -> team -> workspace (via organization/account_login) INSERT INTO workspace_team_repository_settings ( workspace_id, team_id, repository_id, hidden_from_contributions ) SELECT w.id AS workspace_id, trp.team_id, trp.repository_id, true AS hidden_from_contributions FROM team_repository_permission trp INNER JOIN team t ON t.id = trp.team_id INNER JOIN workspace w ON LOWER(w.account_login) = LOWER(t.organization) WHERE trp.hidden_from_contributions = true AND w.status != 'PURGED' -- Skip purged workspaces ON CONFLICT (workspace_id, team_id, repository_id) DO UPDATE SET hidden_from_contributions = EXCLUDED.hidden_from_contributions ;

changeSet.author: ClaudeCode
changeSet.comment:
Clean up duplicate Issue/PullRequest entries with same (repository_id, number). Keeps the record with the most recent updated_at timestamp and deletes the rest. This is necessary before adding the unique constraint.
IMPORTANT: This migration handles all FK references before deleting: - issue_label, issue_assignee (junction tables - delete/merge) - issue_comment, pull_request_review, etc. (re-point to keeper) - issue_blocking, parent_issue_id (re-point to keeper)

changeSet.author: ClaudeCode
changeSet.comment: Add unique constraint on (repository_id, number) to prevent duplicate issues/PRs. GitHub uses a unified number space per repository - a repo cannot have both Issue #5 and PR #5. This constraint enforces that invariant at the database level.

changeSet.author: ClaudeCode
changeSet.comment: Clean up duplicate Team entries with same (organization, name). Keeps the record with the most recent updated_at timestamp and deletes the rest. This is necessary before adding the unique constraint.

changeSet.author: ClaudeCode
changeSet.comment: Add unique constraint on (organization, name) to prevent duplicate teams. GitHub teams are uniquely identified by their organization and name. This constraint enforces that invariant at the database level.

changeSet.author: ClaudeCode
changeSet.comment:
Clean up duplicate User entries with same login. Keeps the record with the most recent updated_at timestamp and deletes the rest.
IMPORTANT: User is referenced by many tables. This migration updates all FK references to point to the kept user before deleting duplicates.
Referenced tables: issue (author_id, merged_by), issue_comment (author_id), pull_request_review (author_id), pull_request_review_comment (author_id), pull_request_review_thread (resolved_by), milestone (creator_id), team_membership (user_id), repository_collaborator (user_id), workspace_membership (user_id), activity_event (actor_id), user_preferences (user_id), chat_thread (user_id), document (user_id), issue_assignee (user_id), pull_request_requested_reviewers (user_id).

changeSet.author: ClaudeCode
changeSet.comment: Add unique constraint on (login) to prevent duplicate users. GitHub users are uniquely identified by their login (username). This constraint enforces that invariant at the database level.
